tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,
review: Pleasant personality, gives enough time to listen to queries. I came to her for a second opinion and loved the way she made me comfortable and did ask if I had any doubts. She had a patient ear to even silly questions. Loved her and would definetly recommend a must visit to her.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Hi, this is Santosh Gupta, My Wife Sapna Jaiswal aged 31 and we had our First baby boy on 16 Dec 2017 under LSCS (THROUGH CEASAREAN) at the time of discharge DR KISHORI KADAM has prescribed for TAB DELISPRIN 75 MG (ONE TABLET daily AT NIGHT) FOR ONE MONTH.
Please note that on 18 Jan 2018 (After 1 month 2 Days of delivery), my wife started vomiting in morning with blood coming out from her mouth for 3 to 4 times in morning itself, later on in Evening its get even bad and she started vomiting with blood and blood clots (Doctors were not clear what was that) so many times I can say after every 5 to 10 minutes.
Next day we come to know that It was because of “GASTRIC VARIX” seen in fundus as per ENDOSCOPIES REPORT.
After that, few friends who are also MBBS and pursuing in medical lines suggested me that Excess bleeding suffered by my wife May be because of tha “TAB DELISPRIN 75 MG” consumed by her for one month.
I have asked Dr Kishori Kadam so many times to give the reason in writing of prescribing “TAB DELISPRIN 75 MG” for month, but she is not ready to give me the reason, I have personally met also with her but she is not ready to give the reason in writing for prescribing the medicine. I HAVE ORIGINAL PRESCRIPTION COPY with me WHERE SHE HAS PRESCRIBED THIS MEDICINE “TAB DELISPRIN 75 MG”

**** ****** ***** ***** ****** ***** ** ** ******* ****** ** *** **** *** ** ****** *** ************** ** **** *** *** ********** ** *** ********

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
context: Pre-Pregnancy Counselling,Pregnancy care and management,Pregnant,Pregnancy Tests,Pregnancy Check Up,
review: Very nice doctor. My wife had consulted her for total 9months pregnancy. She is very well behaved. She understands problem we'll. She explains very nicely. In the duration of 9 months she never hesitate to give us time. Always gave answers to all the questions we did ask in every visit. Mostly recommend her because she will not be impatient to do cesarean delivery unless it is absolutely required. She did normal delivery for my wife's case. Would highly recommend her.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Extremely well-behaved and experienced doctor. Answered every query in details and made me comfortable. I felt in safe hands during my pregnancy check ups and Dr Kishori handled a risky twin pregnancy with utmost care. The staff and resident doctors are also equally good and take great care of the patient. Thank you Dr. Kishori and Dr. Divya.

tags: None
review: The only drawback about the clinic is that they don't adhere to appointment. I was given an appointment for 4:30 which was postponed to 5:30 and when I met the doctor it was 6:45 pm. Really appreciate that I was called and informed about the appointment being pushed to 5:30 pm. Dr. Kishori was really good. She explained all details very well. Didn't rush between patients, gave complete attention to me and spent good 30 mins. Would really recommend her.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,Value for money,
review: I would definitely not recommend her, since she doesn't give  over 2mins to any patient. She prescribed me tests which upon getting a second opinion were found to be completely unnecessary and irrelevant to PCOD. She takes no time to comfort the patient or answer their doubts. Extremely evasive and not at all invested in the patient's problem
